questions.question: Find \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) if \(y = \frac{xe^{2x}}{x^2 + 1}\)
questions.explanation: Using quotient rule with product rule: u = xe²ˣ, u' = e²ˣ + 2xe²ˣ = e²ˣ(1+2x); v = x²+1, v' = 2x. Result: [e²ˣ(1+2x)(x²+1) - xe²ˣ·2x]/(x²+1)² = e²ˣ[(1+2x)(x²+1) - 2x²]/(x²+1)² = e²ˣ(2x³+3x²+x+2)/(x²+1)²

questions.question: Find \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) if \(y = \frac{\sin(x^2)}{x}\)
questions.explanation: Using quotient rule: u = sin(x²), u' = 2x·cos(x²); v = x, v' = 1. Result: [2x·cos(x²)·x - sin(x²)·1]/x² = [2x²·cos(x²) - sin(x²)]/x²

questions.question: Find \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) if \(y = \frac{e^{x^2}}{\sin x}\)
options: \(\frac{e^{x^2}(2x\sin^2 x - \sin x\cos x + x\cos x)}{\sin^3 x}\)
questions.explanation: Using quotient rule: u = e^(x²), u' = 2x·e^(x²); v = sin x, v' = cos x. Result: [2x·e^(x²)·sin x - e^(x²)·cos x]/sin²x = e^(x²)(2x·sin x - cos x)/sin²x

questions.question: Find \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) if \(y = \frac{\ln(1 + x^3)}{x^2}\)
questions.explanation: Using quotient rule: u = ln(1+x³), u' = 3x²/(1+x³); v = x², v' = 2x. Result: [(3x²/(1+x³))·x² - ln(1+x³)·2x]/x⁴ = [3x⁴/(1+x³) - 2x·ln(1+x³)]/x⁴ = [3x⁴ - 2x(1+x³)ln(1+x³)]/[x⁴(1+x³)]

questions.question: Find \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) if \(y = \frac{x^3 + e^x}{x^2 + e^x}\)
questions.explanation: Using quotient rule: u = x³+eˣ, u' = 3x²+eˣ; v = x²+eˣ, v' = 2x+eˣ. Result: [(3x²+eˣ)(x²+eˣ) - (x³+eˣ)(2x+eˣ)]/(x²+eˣ)²

questions.question: Find \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) if \(y = \frac{\tan(2x)}{x^2 + 1}\)
questions.explanation: Using quotient rule: u = tan(2x), u' = 2sec²(2x); v = x²+1, v' = 2x. Result: [2sec²(2x)(x²+1) - tan(2x)·2x]/(x²+1)² = 2[(x²+1)sec²(2x) - x·tan(2x)]/(x²+1)²

questions.question: Find \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) if \(y = \frac{\sqrt{x^2 + 4}}{xe^x}\)
questions.explanation: Using quotient rule: u = √(x²+4), u' = x/√(x²+4); v = xeˣ, v' = eˣ + xeˣ = eˣ(1+x). Result: [(x/√(x²+4))·xeˣ - √(x²+4)·eˣ(1+x)]/(xeˣ)² = eˣ[x²/√(x²+4) - (1+x)√(x²+4)]/(x²e²ˣ) = [x²/√(x²+4) - (1+x)√(x²+4)]/(x²eˣ)

questions.question: Find \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) if \(y = \frac{x^2\sin x}{e^x}\)
options: \(e^{-x}[2x\sin x + x^2\cos x - x^2\sin x + 2x\cos x]\)
questions.explanation: Using quotient rule with product rule: u = x²sin x, u' = 2x·sin x + x²·cos x; v = eˣ, v' = eˣ. Result: [(2x·sin x + x²·cos x)eˣ - x²sin x·eˣ]/e²ˣ = eˣ[2x·sin x + x²·cos x - x²·sin x]/e²ˣ = e⁻ˣ[2x·sin x + x²(cos x - sin x)]

questions.question: Find \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) if \(y = \frac{\cos^2 x}{1 + \sin x}\)
options: \(-\frac{2\sin x\cos x(1 + \sin x) + \cos^3 x + \sin x\cos^2 x}{(1 + \sin x)^3}\)
questions.explanation: Using quotient rule: u = cos²x, u' = -2cos x·sin x; v = 1+sin x, v' = cos x. Result: [-2cos x·sin x(1+sin x) - cos²x·cos x]/(1+sin x)² = -cos x[2sin x(1+sin x) + cos²x]/(1+sin x)²

questions.question: Find \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) if \(y = \frac{\ln(\tan x)}{x^2}\)
questions.explanation: Using quotient rule: u = ln(tan x), u' = sec²x/tan x; v = x², v' = 2x. Result: [(sec²x/tan x)·x² - ln(tan x)·2x]/x⁴ = [x²sec²x/tan x - 2x·ln(tan x)]/x⁴ = sec²x/(x²tan x) - 2ln(tan x)/x³

scoreMessages.90: Excellent work! You have mastered advanced quotient rule differentiation.
scoreMessages.70: Good job! You understand most quotient rule concepts but could use some review of combined rules.
scoreMessages.50: Not bad! Review the quotient rule applications with product and chain rules you missed.
scoreMessages.0: Keep practicing! Focus on understanding how to combine quotient rule with product and chain rules.
